meanings.definition: A photograph taken with the subject in silhouette against a bright background.
meanings.sent1: The artist displayed a collection of shadowgraphs at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: I love how shadowgraphs capture the contrast between light and dark.
meanings.sent3: The shadowgraphs of the trees looked like mysterious figures dancing in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like shadowgraphs, faint but still present in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the shadowgraphs left a lasting impression on the viewers.

meanings.definition: A two-dimensional representation of an object or scene in which the outlines are filled in with black.
meanings.sent1: The children created shadowgraphs of animals using paper cutouts.
meanings.sent2: The shadowgraphs of buildings in the cityscape were striking.
meanings.sent3: The shadowgraphs of the clouds on the wall looked like a storm brewing indoors.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like shadowgraphs, clear outlines against the backdrop of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The artist's use of shadowgraphs added depth and drama to the artwork.
